sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>cheap</radical> <radical>tree</radical> has a <kanji>plan</kanji>. A plan to stay cheap.
meaningInfo: Picture a tree coming up with some elaborate plans to make sure they can spend as little money as possible.
readingMnemonic: The cheap tree's <kanji>plan</kanji> involves only buying <reading>an</reading>chovies (<ja>あん</ja>) and surviving on them. Good exposure to the sun and fresh water is too expensive. The tree plans to save money by eating anchovies.
readingInfo: You're not sure about this anchovy plan. Are you cheap enough to choose a life of eating only anchovies?
